what: Brand Guideline Styling for New York City Council Reports & Dashboards
title: Brand Guideline Styling for New York City Council Reports & Dashboards
text: councildown package implements style guide compliant defaults R Markdown documents, ggplot2 plots, leaflet maps.

title: Brand Guideline Styling for New York City Council Reports & Dashboards
text: can install released version councildown GitHub

title: Brand Guideline Styling for New York City Council Reports & Dashboards
text: Note order loading libraries important. Make sure load councildown last.

title: Brand Guideline Styling for New York City Council Reports & Dashboards
text: demo functions available, see vignettes/councilverse.Rmd councilverse package.

title: Brand Guideline Styling for New York City Council Reports & Dashboards
text: First load councildown package .

title: Brand Guideline Styling for New York City Council Reports & Dashboards
text: load, common ggplot2 scale_* functions overwritten scale_fill_nycc() scale_color_nycc(). 6 color palettes available scale_fill_nycc() scale_color_nycc(). Check documentation full default parameters. brand guidelines, see: https://newyorkcitycouncil.github.io/nycc-brand-guidelines/. palette = "main" use primary Council colors. Default scale_color_nycc().palette = "mixed" secondary Council colors. Default scale_fill_nycc().palette = "bw" grey scale.palette = "warm" warm palette.palette = "cool" cool palette.palette = "diverging" diverging palette. palette = "single" color first color "main". palette = "double", color first second color "main".  Additionally, theme_nycc() argument facet changing theme better fit faceted plots. using one variable/color, can add "single" palette using pal_nycc. Use "double" palette two variables/colors.
code: data.frame(x = rnorm(20), y = rnorm(20), z = c("a", "b")) %>%   ggplot(aes(x, y, color = z)) +  geom_point() +  labs(title = "Test",       subtitle = "Test",       caption = "Test",       color = "Legend",       x = "Test a",       y = "Test b") +   scale_color_nycc() +   theme_nycc() data.frame(x = rnorm(20), y = rnorm(20), z = c("a", "b")) %>%   ggplot(aes(x, y, color = z)) +  geom_point() +  labs(title = "Test",       subtitle = "Test",       caption = "Test",       color = "Legend",       x = "Test a",       y = "Test b") +   facet_wrap(~z) +   scale_color_nycc() +   theme_nycc(facet=TRUE) data.frame(x = rnorm(20), y = rnorm(20)) %>%   ggplot(aes(x, y)) +  geom_point(color = pal_nycc("single")) +  labs(title = "Test",       subtitle = "Test",       caption = "Test",       color = "Legend",       x = "Test a",       y = "Test b") +   theme_nycc()

title: Brand Guideline Styling for New York City Council Reports & Dashboards
text: function addCouncilStyle() sets default view, zoom, background. additional option add_dists add map tiles City Council district outlines labels leaflet maps. dist_year option allows "2023" "2013" Council District lines.  Additionally, use mapshot save leaflet maps static png image. mapshot() overwrites mapview::mapshot() force map saves standardized width, height, zoom. Use mapview::mapshot want original mapshot function.
code: library(leaflet) leaflet() %>%    addCouncilStyle(add_dists = T, dist_year = "2023") map <- leaflet() %>%    addCouncilStyle(add_dists = T, dist_year = "2023") mapshot(map, file = "map.png")

title: Brand Guideline Styling for New York City Council Reports & Dashboards
text: package includes R Markdown template writing Council reports. installing package, create new report choosing New > R Markdown > Template > City Council Report RStudio. [Progress]

title: Style a leaflet map — addCouncilStyle
text: Style leaflet map

title: Style a leaflet map — addCouncilStyle
code: addCouncilStyle(   map,   add_dists = FALSE,   highlight_dists = NULL,   dist_year = "2013",   highlight_color = "#cdd9f1",   minZoom = 10,   maxZoom = 15 )

title: Style a leaflet map — addCouncilStyle
text: map leaflet map add_dists Boolean. Add council districts? highlight_dists vector including numbers council districts like use non-standard color numeric label. Especially useful using "cool" palette council districts label color blends right . dist_year Either "2013" (2013-2023 lines) "2023" (2023-2033 lines). highlight_color used specify list highlight_dists color text. Defaults white minZoom Minimum zoom level map. Defaults 10. maxZoom Maximum zoom level map. Defaults 15.

title: Style a leaflet map — addCouncilStyle
text: leaflet map City Council styles, including tiles,    council district outlines, fonts

title: Style a leaflet map — addCouncilStyle
code: library(leaflet) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘leaflet’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:councildown’: #>  #>     addPolygons, colorBin library(councildown) leaflet() %>%  addCouncilStyle(add_dists=TRUE) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘leaflet.extras’

title: addLegend - but with the option for the highest number to be at the top of the legend — addLegend_decreasing
code: addLegend_decreasing(   map,   position = c("topright", "bottomright", "bottomleft", "topleft"),   pal,   values,   na.label = "NA",   bins = 7,   colors,   opacity = 0.5,   labels = NULL,   labFormat = labelFormat(),   title = NULL,   className = "info legend",   layerId = NULL,   group = NULL,   data = getMapData(map),   decreasing = FALSE )

title: mapshot pdf — mapshot
text: mapshot adjustment saves maps pdf warns users choose png

title: mapshot pdf — mapshot
code: mapshot(   x,   url = NULL,   file = NULL,   zoom = 2,   vwidth = 1000,   vheight = 850,   remove_controls = c("zoomControl", "layersControl", "homeButton", "scaleBar",     "drawToolbar", "easyButton"),   ... )

title: mapshot pdf — mapshot
text: x mapview leaflet object (hmtlwidget). url Output .html file. supplied 'file' specified, temporary index file created. file Output .png, .pdf, .jpeg file. remove_controls character vector control buttons removed map saving file. combination "zoomControl", "layersControl", "homeButton", "scaleBar", "drawToolbar", "easyButton". set NULL nothing removed. Ignord x mapview leaflet map. ... arguments passed saveWidget /webshot.

title: mapshot pdf — mapshot
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(leaflet) library(councildown) m <- leaflet() %>%  addTiles() %>%  addCouncilStyle(add_dists = TRUE) mapshot(m, file = "test.png") file.remove("test.png") } # }

title: Color and fill scales for ggplots — scale_fill_nycc
text: functions scale_*_continuous scale_*_discrete exported package aliases functions scale_*_nycc appropriate default arguments. , colors overwrite ggplot2's default scales. prevent , either set scales manually plots calling ggplot2::scale_*, attach ggplot2 councildown.

title: Color and fill scales for ggplots — scale_fill_nycc
code: scale_fill_nycc(palette = "mixed", discrete = TRUE, reverse = FALSE, ...)  scale_color_nycc(palette = "main", discrete = TRUE, reverse = FALSE, ...)  scale_color_discrete(palette = "main", discrete = TRUE, reverse = FALSE, ...)  scale_color_continuous(...)  scale_fill_discrete(palette = "mixed", discrete = TRUE, reverse = FALSE, ...)  scale_fill_continuous(...)

title: New York City Council Theme — theme_nycc
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(ggplot2) library(councildown) data.frame(x = rnorm(20), y = rnorm(20), z = c("a", "b")) %>%   ggplot(aes(x, y, color = z)) +  geom_point() +  labs(title = "Test",       subtitle = "Test",       caption = "Test",       color = "Legend",       x = "Test a",       y = "Test b") +  facet_wrap(~z) +  theme_nycc(facet=TRUE) +  scale_color_nycc() } # }
